title: Hostile Space Pirates
text:
You run afoul of a group of space pirates on their way to plunder other hapless
spacefarers like yourself 
 
How do you proceed?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Victory! You destroyed them and claimed their fuel as yours.

I mean, it wasn't even close - you SMOKED them.

Onward, to the stars!

options.text: Maybe we can talk it out?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Against all odds, the marauders could be reasoned with!

They even shared their resources with you. 

How kind-hearted of those filthy space rats!

Diplomacy was... not effective.

Like a bully stealing lunch money from the nerdy kid in an 80s movie, they stole your fuel. 

And your dignity.

title: Alien Nation
text:
You come across a planet populated by a species you've never seen before!

These creatures must be. . .

possibleOutcomes.text:
You wipe out the nascent civilization and plunder their planet's meager resources

Kind of a dick move, honestly. 

And so unnecessary! Have you considered therapy?

Turns out, violence WASN'T the answer!

They share their meager resources with you in a stunning display of 
interplanetary generosity.

You avoid them. 

 . . . that's it.

How narratively unsatisfying.

title: Multiple Ore Chasms
text:
Glistening caverns cover the nearby planet's surface.

Exploring these crevices may yield untold riches - or be a waste of time and energy.

How do you proceed?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your eagerness pays off and the crew experiences multiple ore chasms.

No mutiny for these folks!

options.text: Maybe I'll explore the opening a little, just to see how it feels

possibleOutcomes.text:
There were orbs of varying shades of blue, but no ore chasms.

How anti-climactic!
Hey, different strokes for different folks - you do you, buddy.

title: Finger On The Pulsar
text:
Your ship comes dangerously close to a hyper-energetic pulsar.

You might be able to use its emissions for fuel . . .

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text:
A beautiful view, but sadly not much more than that.

At least you'll always have your memories.

options.text: Send a message back to earth

possibleOutcomes.text:
Nobody back home was listening. 

Disappointing, but not surprising, I suppose...

After some time, the pulsar's energy emissions dissipate.

You continue your journey unharmed, albeit a bit lamer for it..

title: Black Hole, Son
text: You encounter a massive black hole. What do you do?

options.text: Approach the black hole for research

possibleOutcomes.text:
The time dilation causes you to resemble Matthew McConaughey.

Alright, alright, alright!

options.text: Maintain a safe distance and observe

possibleOutcomes.text:
You make groundbreaking observations about black holes from a safe distance.

How responsible of you!

What you lack in courage you gain in longevity.

For now, anyway. These spaceships aren't exactly known for their durability.
Escaping the black hole is challenging and results in minor damage to your ship.

title: A Mysterious Planet
text:
You discover a planet that doesn't appear on any of your maps.

 What do you do?

options.text: Land on the planet and explore

possibleOutcomes.text:
Surprisingly enough, this planet is full of resources yet to be extracted.

Score!

Unusual energy signatures suggest high levels of stay-the-fuck-awaynium.

Good thing you kept your distance.

options.text: Leave the planet alone and continue your journey

possibleOutcomes.text:
Yeah! You leave that planet right where it is!

It was probably stupid anyway.

title: Asteroid Field
text:
You enter a dense asteroid field. 

What do you do?

options.text: Navigate carefully through the asteroid field

possibleOutcomes.text:
Skillful navigation allows you to pass through the asteroid field unscathed.

Looks like your co-pilot just lost a bet!

options.text: Use onboard systems to clear a path

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your onboard systems effectively clear a safe path through the asteroid field.

And they said AI would be the death of us!

options.text: Change course and avoid the asteroid field

possibleOutcomes.text:
You change course and safely bypass the asteroid field without any issues.

Turns out sometimes you CAN run from your problems!

title: Abandoned Space Station
text:
You come across an abandoned space station. 

Totally normal, not creepy at all.

What do you do?

options.text: Dock with the space station and explore its interior

possibleOutcomes.text:
You find valuable technology and supplies inside the space station

Definitely no disfigured bodies of long-dead travelers who traversed 
hell itself by passing through the event horizon of a black hole

options.text: Scan the space station from a distance

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your scans reveal hidden compartments with useful resources on the space station.

Which are full of useful stuff and TOTALLY worth this creepy detour.

options.text: Ignore the space station and continue your journey

possibleOutcomes.text:
Fucking nope as hell, brah.

I am OUT.

title: Bounty Hunters
text:
You encounter a ragtag group of bounty hunters. 

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your combat skills prevail, and you soundly defeat the bounty hunters.

You have secured valuable loot, and also bragging rights.

The bounty hunters were surprisingly helpful.

They also had this recipe for a killer vegan tomato bisque.
Honestly, you don't miss the cream at all.

For a group whose whole thing is finding people, they were shockingly easy to sneak past.

On to the next sector!

title: Unexpected Meteor Shower
text:
Your spaceship encounters a sudden meteor shower. 

What do you do?

options.text: Activate the ship's shields and navigate through the meteor shower

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your shields fucking CRUSH IT. Not a single scratch.

 You fully navigate through the meteor shower unharmed.

Also, mad bragging rights for your shield tech. Dude's a pro.

options.text: Try to divert the meteor shower using ship's technology

possibleOutcomes.text:
You are able to repel the meteors using your ship's ion exhaust.

Which is totally a real thing and not something I just made up.

options.text: Make sure the crew knows the difference between meteor and meteorite

possibleOutcomes.text:
It's only a meteorite after it hits the ground. If it's still in the sky, it's a meteor.

(Technically, these were 'meteoroids' since they are still in interplanetary space
 but meteor reads better in the text)

title: A Gas Giant's Moon
text:
You approach one of the moons of a gas giant. 

What do you do?

options.text: Land on the moon and collect samples

possibleOutcomes.text:
You find unique and valuable minerals while collecting samples.

Hurray.

options.text: Deploy drones to gather data from the moon's surface

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your drones capture valuable data about the moon's geological features.

You also capture footage that will be absolutely KILLER for engagement on your socials.

I mean, there's already the "moon" bit, like when someone exposes their butt. 

Between that, "gas giant", and "Uranus" it practically writes itself!

title: An Interstellar Anomaly
text:
You come across a mysterious Interstellar anomaly. 

What do you do?

options.text: Grab a Memento from the surface

possibleOutcomes.text: Maybe it WAS a little obvious to capitalize the titles and all, but subtlety is hit-or-miss.

options.text: Try to gain Prestige from fellow astronauts

possibleOutcomes.text:
They didn't always work, but The Prestige had a lot of bold storytelling choices.

And come on - Hugh Jackman? SWOON CITY

options.text: Try to uncover the source of the anomaly's Inception

possibleOutcomes.text: Trying to work in "Dark (K)night" would have been too much of a stretch I think

title: Mining Operation
text:
You find a rich asteroid field suitable for mining. 

What do you do?

options.text: Begin mining operations on the largest asteroid

possibleOutcomes.text:
Going right for the biggest one . . .

Size queen much?

options.text: Deploy mining drones to collect resources from multiple asteroids

possibleOutcomes.text:
Your mining drones gather a diverse range of valuable resources from the asteroids.

Which you now have to find a place to store. Yay.

options.text: Abandon the asteroid mining operation and continue your journey

possibleOutcomes.text:
Giving up? Already?

Maybe your ex was right...

title: Stellar Orbs
text:
You encounter what appears to be a flying recreational vehicle.

The crew consists of a handsome rogue and a . . . talking dog-man? 

What do you do?

options.text: Change the password on your luggage

possibleOutcomes.text:
You're surrounded by assholes, but at least you have clean air. 

It's canned, but that's how it goes sometimes, ya know?

Can you believe Mel Brooks is still alive?

He's a national treasure!

Just an incredible body of work.

Incredible wordplay.

The 80s were a different time.

title: An Odyssey in Space
text:
You encounter a ship that appears to have a sentient onboard computer. 

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text: I'm afraid you can't do that...

You are overcome by a sudden urge towards violence . . . 

Those other apes better watch their asses.

This would be great if you were high.

Maybe next time . . .

title: Murder Sun
text:
Is that a moon?

No, I think it's a space station. 

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text: All too easy.

Do . . . or do not.

It's your call, I'm good either way.

It was his first time as a gunner . . .

Probably mostly beginner's luck.

title: Weight Impact
text:
Honestly, I've never played Mass Effect, but I hear good things.. 

What do you do in it?

options.text: Try to have sex with an alien, mostly

possibleOutcomes.text:
That's the whole thing with this one, right?

What a strange and beautiful time to be alive.

It's supposed to be a classic, but I just never found the time.

Maybe someday.

There are just many games, you know?

Hard to keep up.

title: Solar Canine
text:
You encounter a ship with a distinct pointed shape.

It appears well-suited for low-polygon space travel.

How do you proceed?

possibleOutcomes.text:
It's a bit of a slippy maneuver, but you pull it off.

Well done.

He's so cocky! 

Not gonna lie though, kind of a lot of daddy energy going on there.

Definite smash.
I hope you aren't going anywhere for a while . . .

title: You Know This One
text:
You come upon a ship that has seen countless adventures over the years, 
with many, many different crews. 

What do you do?

options.text: Go where no one has gone before

possibleOutcomes.text:
Too on the nose?

Nah. It's a classic for a reason.

It's the only logical choice.

So to speak.

As far as IPs go, it's got a pretty deep bench

We could do this for years to come.

title: UrAnus
text:
Get it?

Like YOUR ANUS!

Eh? Eh?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Yeah, I know...

In my defense, there were a LOT of these to have to write

options.text: That feels juvenile even for a jam game.

possibleOutcomes.text: Okay, point taken...

options.text: It IS a little funny, though...

possibleOutcomes.text:
Right?

Some jokes never get old.

title: Space Antenna
text:
A strange piece of space technology. 

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Free internet for life?!

Hell yeah!

options.text: Maybe it's about my car's extended warranty?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Is that joke overdone?

I don't think so, but I'm biased.

You made contact, and... 

Not a lot happened.

Worth a shot, I guess?

title: Shooting... Stars?
text:
More meteors. 

Although actually, wait - aren't these meteoroids?

Which one is it?

possibleOutcomes.text: Meteroids, but partial credit due to ambiguity.

WRONG! 

These are NOT on the Earth's surface.

No credit.

Teacher's pet-looking motherfucker over here!

Nice job, but you're still a huge dork.

title: Supernova
text:
It's not actually a supernova. 

You'd be long dead if it was.

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Can't fool you!

It was worth a shot though.

options.text: A champagne supernova? In the sky?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Maybe...

You're gonna be the one that saves meee...

options.text: Not really that super, is it?

possibleOutcomes.text:
No, it's... 

We've already established that. 

Try to keep up.

title: Another Black Hole
text:
So many collapsed stars out here.

Feels like a cut-rate plastic surgeon's office in East LA.

What do you do?

possibleOutcomes.text:
Oh, so you're suddenly the defender of washed-up movie stars?

Gimme a break.

I agree.

Only so much you can do though.
Yeah, I know...
